question.question-text: Why are the students discussing the topic?

answer-list.answer-text: They are reviewing information that will be on an exam.
They are preparing to attend an upcoming lecture.
They are going over a presentation they will be giving.
They are reviewing textbook material they just read.

question.explain-text: In the discussion, the first man states that we need to understand the information from the lecture for the next exam. This means that they are reviewing information that will be on an exam. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: How do the students seem to feel about the material?

answer-list.answer-text: They are unimpressed.
They are nervous.
They are enthusiastic.
They are worried.

question.explain-text: In the discussion, the first woman says that that was a fascinating lecture, wasn't it, the man replies it certainly was, and the second woman adds I really enjoyed the lecture, too. From this, it can be determined that the students are enthusiatic about the material. The third answer is therefore the best answer to the question.

question.question-text: Why did scientists use to believe that little life was possible at the bottom of the ocean?

answer-list.answer-text: Because of the lack of oxygen
Because there was too much smoke

question.explain-text: In the discussion, the first woman states that for a long time, scientists thought that there was little or no life at the bottom of the ocean...not just because it's so cold, but also because of the lack of sunlight. This means that scientists used to believe that little life was possible at the bottom of the ocean because of the temperature and because there was no sunlight. The first and third answers are therefore the best answers to this question.

question.question-text: Why are the underwater volcanoes called black smokers?

answer-list.answer-text: Hot water coming out of them resembles black smoke.
The lava in them has a smoky color.
The volcanoes smell like smoke.
The ocean water in which they are located is so dark.

question.explain-text: In the discussion, the second woman states that these underwater volcanoes are called black smokers because, when the hot, hot, water shoots out, it looks like black smoke. This means that hot water coming out of them resembles black smoke. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Are these statements about black smokers true, according to the passage?

answer-list.answer-text: They really are volcanoes.
The water near them is heated.
They kill off the living beings around them.

They are part of the process of
chemosynthesis.

explain-list.explain-text: The first woman mentions black smokers and states that they actually are volcanoes on the ocean floor. This means that it is true about black smokers that they really are volcanoes. You should therefore click in the YES column.

The first man states that this water from the black smokers heats up the cold, cold water around them. This means that it is true about black smokers that the water near them is heated. You should therefore click in the YES column.

The first woman states that scientists now know there's a tremendous amount of thriving life down in the depths of the ocean around the black smokers. This means that it is NOT true about black smokers that they kill off the living beings around them. You should therefore click in the NO column.

The second man states that life in the depths of the ocean is dependent on chemosynthesis and goes on to explain that the volcanic water heated by the earth's inner core is full of minerals and that when the heated water erupts from the black smokers, the bacteria around the black smokers are able to metabolize the minerals. From this, it can be determined that it is true about black smokers that they are part of the process of chemosynthesis. You should therefore click in the YES column.

question.question-text: How do black smokers help to support life?

answer-list.answer-text: They provide oxygen.
They make photosynthesis possible.
They provide warmth.
They provide nourishment.

question.explain-text: In the discussion, the second man states that the black smokers do more than provide heat to support life. They also provide food. This means that the black smokers support life by providing warmth and nourishment. The third and fourth answers are therefore the best answers to this question.
